oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cedarcrest Jamboree - 01-17 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Segment of Cedarcrest shoes sponsored radio program Cedarcrest Jamboree, orginally broadcast January 17, year unknown, as stated on cue sheet and label. Featuring Louis Buck (announcer), Carl Smith (host ,announcer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Bobby Forrester (performer), Grady Martin (performer), and Martha Carson (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Little Jimmy Dickens; Carl Smith; Martha Carson; Grady Martin; Bobby Forrester
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Louis Buck announces line-up -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Louis Buck) -- Louis Buck introduces Carl Smith -- I Betcha My Heart I Love You (Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith introduces Grady Martin -- Cotton-Eyed Joe (Grady Martin fiddle) -- Carl Smith talks about the performance and introduces Martha Carson -- Martha Carson talks about Cedarcrest shoes -- I Wanna Rest (Martha Carson) -- Carl Smith introduces Bobby Forrester -- Blue Bonnet Rag (Bobby Forrester steel guitar) -- Carl Smith introduces the next song -- (When You Feel Like You're In Love) Don't Just Stand There (Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith talks about the performance and introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Little Jimmy Dickens tells jokes and introduces the next song -- Wedding Bell Waltz (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Carl Smith talks about the performance and introduces Martha Carson -- Martha Carson introduces the next song -- Fear Not (Martha Carson) -- Carl Smith introduces the next song -- This Side Of Heaven (Carl Smith) (incomplete, dropout) -- Carl Smith introduces Grady Martin -- Eighth Of January (Grady Martin fiddle) -- Carl Smith introduces Martha Carson -- I Feel It In My Soul (Martha Carson) -- Closing statement (Carl Smith and Louis Buck) -- Closing theme
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Cedarcrest jamboree (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Smith, Carl, 1927-2010; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-2015; Carson, Martha; Forrester, Bobby; Martin, Grady, 1929-;
